text.p: ABC television has withdrawn from negotions for a new show designed to be a spinoff of the eries "Roseanne", the New York Times said Friday.
According to executives close to negotiations between the network, owned by Disney, and Carsey-Werner Productions, which produces "Roseanne," the series would find a new home, the paper said.
One executive familiar with the talks said the show, which would not be called "Roseanne", could find a different network "within a matter of days," the Times reported.
For a time, "Roseanne" was the highest-rated show on television but its ratings have declined in recent years.
ABC was unwilling to pay the price asked by the production company and allowed its option on the new series to expire, the Times said.
